message.content:
Below is one worked‐through example of how to recreate exactly what is shown in the “target” picture using only the block‐orientations given in the dictionary (no rotations beyond what is shown).  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Overall Block Count and Layers  
  – There are 13 total blocks used.  
  – They form two separate assemblies:  
    1) A “chair‐like” tower (10 blocks, stacked in five layers).  
    2) A small wedge‐shaped piece on the ground (3 blocks).  

• Chair‐like Structure (Layers from bottom to top)  
  – Layer 1 (bottom): 4 orange cylinders (the “legs”).  
  – Layer 2: 3 yellow rectangular prisms laid side‐by‐side (forming the “seat”).  
  – Layer 3: 1 green cube centered on top of the seat.  
  – Layer 4: 1 blue cube on top of the green cube.  
  – Layer 5 (top): 1 yellow half‐cylinder (arched) resting atop the blue cube.  

• Small Wedge‐Shaped Assembly (on the ground, to one side)  
  – It is made from 3 blocks set side by side: two orange triangular wedges flanking a blue cube, so that from the front you see an orange‐blue‐orange “triangular” prism.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED DICTIONARY BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Match each visible piece in the target to its correctly oriented counterpart:

• Chair‐like Structure:  
  – Orange Cylinders (legs): Block #5. (Used 4 times)  
  – Yellow Seat Planks: Block #3. (Used 3 times, all laid horizontally exactly as shown for #3)  
  – Green Cube: Block #2. (Used once)  
  – Blue Cube (tower): Block #1. (Used once)  
  – Yellow Half‐Cylinder/Arch (top): Block #7. (Used once, matches the front‐to‐back arch orientation)  

• Small Wedge Piece:  
  – Center Blue Cube: Block #1. (Used again here)  
  – Left Orange Wedge: Block #13.  
  – Right Orange Wedge: Block #14.  

Hence the **indices needed** (and the number of each) are:  
• #1 (blue cube) × 2 total  
• #2 (green cube) × 1  
• #3 (yellow rectangular prism) × 3  
• #5 (orange cylinder) × 4  
• #7 (yellow half‐cylinder) × 1  
• #13 (orange wedge) × 1  
• #14 (orange wedge) × 1  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one possible build order (you may reorder steps if you wish, so long as the final stack matches):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 5   //1st orange cylinder leg  
  Step2:  Move block with index 5   //2nd orange cylinder leg  
  Step3:  Move block with index 5   //3rd orange cylinder leg  
  Step4:  Move block with index 5   //4th orange cylinder leg  
  Step5:  Move block with index 3   //1st yellow seat plank  
  Step6:  Move block with index 3   //2nd yellow seat plank  
  Step7:  Move block with index 3   //3rd yellow seat plank  
  Step8:  Move block with index 2   //green cube on top of seat  
  Step9:  Move block with index 1   //blue cube on top of green  
  Step10: Move block with index 7   //yellow arch on very top  
  Step11: Move block with index 1   //blue cube for the small wedge piece  
  Step12: Move block with index 13  //left orange wedge  
  Step13: Move block with index 14  //right orange wedge  
}

That completes the structure exactly as shown in the target image, using only the given dictionary orientations.
